cves.description: The WPForms – Easy Form Builder for WordPress – Contact Forms, Payment Forms, Surveys, & More plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the start_timestamp parameter in all versions up to, and including, 1.9.5 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

affected.product: WPForms – Easy Form Builder for WordPress – Contact Forms, Payment Forms, Surveys, & More

problemType: CWE-79 Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

cves.description: A vulnerability has been found in JAdmin-JAVA JAdmin 1.0 and classified as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file /memoAjax/save. The manipulation of the argument ID leads to cross site scripting. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
